Post Text: Never Been Promoted? Me Neither - Get advice from the guy with a cut tie, 2 thumbs, and one finger pointing at you with a creative (yet real) list of ways to never be promoted so you may launch yourself into entrepreneurship.1. Bonus points if you can loop in departments that have nothing to do with the topic. The goal is to create a perpetual meeting loop where nothing gets done.4. Embrace casual Friday every day and take it to new heights. Think Hawaiian shirts for board meetings and flip-flops for client presentations. You're not just an employee; you're on a never-ending vacation from responsibility. 5. Be the most active on all company social media posts. No article, photo, or announcement should go without your insightful comment: "Nice!" or "LOL üòÇ." It's all about visibility!6. Develop a mysterious ailment that flares up during important deadlines or whenever someone mentions the word "overtime." It's crucial to keep them guessing whether it's chronic laziness or just an exotic virus.7. Gradually extend your lunch hour to a lunch afternoon. Return to work with no explanation other than a contented smile and a sun tan. Work-life balance is essential, after all. Leave as early as you can.8. Start every project with gusto and then slowly let the enthusiasm wane until it's unclear what the project was about in the first place. If anyone asks, you're "pivoting to a new strategy."9. During performance reviews, nod sagely while misunderstanding every piece of constructive feedback. Translate "needs improvement in time management" to "needs more time to manage."!0. Expense everything you can to the company. From pet grooming because your cat's stress levels affect your productivity, to meditation apps because a zen employee is a happy employee. Remember, it's about investing in your well-being for long-term gain. Post Text: Build the life you want‚Ä¶ - Arthur BrooksToday I went to a live leadership lab at hosted by Andy Stanley at Northpoint.org's main campus.   The guest speaker was Harvard professor and 13-time author, Arthur Brooks, discussed the art and science of becoming happier. He shed light on the reality of happiness in your 40s and beyond, explaining why it may not always be achieved despite all the indicators of a good life. He narrated stories of successful people who were not content with their lives.Arthur suggested three things to find happiness post 40. Firstly, find your second curve in life by focusing on fluid intelligence and crystallized intelligence. Fluid intelligence refers to your analytical capabilities, while crystallized intelligence describes the experiential knowledge you acquire over your life. Secondly, have fewer wants. He gave a great metaphor of eastern art vs western art. Western art focuses on a blank canvas where you add more and more brush strokes, but eventually, you can't add anymore and end up with nothing new. On the other hand, in eastern art, you look at a massive jade boulder and chip away at it to reveal the art that lies within.Lastly, don't miss out. He painted another metaphor of a single tree vs an aspen stand. The single tree focuses only on its leaves while the aspen is connected all from its roots. Focus on your roots, the people in and around your life, and be present with them now.Overall, his advice was inspirational, and I am looking forward to reading his books and growing in my life to become happier.#behappy #balancedlife #entrepreneurlife #entrepreneurship #entrepreneur

Author: Thomas Helfrich
Post Text: Stop guessing what to do on LinkedIn.It's not that hard. There are no shortcuts. Embrace your humanity first. üëá Every day, millions of users log onto LinkedIn to network, share content, and seek opportunities. But many are left scratching their heads, wondering, "What am I supposed to post? How should I engage? How can I stand out amidst the cacophony?"There's a secret to navigating LinkedIn successfully, and it's not about mastering some mysterious algorithm or deploying the latest AI tool. It's about being human first, and leveraging technology second.1. Humanity Over AlgorithmsYour LinkedIn network isn't just a list of profile photos and job titles. Behind each profile lies a person with aspirations, challenges, and stories. Instead of aiming to impress a vague digital audience, visualize speaking to a friend, a colleague, or a mentor. Write, share, and engage in a way that feels genuine and heartfelt. Algorithms might determine reach, but genuine human connections determine impact.2. Share Authentic StoriesGone are the days when LinkedIn was just a digital CV platform. Today, it's a storytelling arena. Share moments from your career, lessons learned, and even those not-so-perfect experiences. Vulnerability and authenticity resonate more than a polished, flawless image. 3. Engage, Don't Just BroadcastIt's easy to post and forget. But the true essence of LinkedIn lies in engagement. Comment thoughtfully on others' posts. Offer support, provide insights, or just send a word of encouragement. It's in these micro-interactions that relationships are forged.4. Use Technology as an Amplifier, Not a CrutchYes, LinkedIn offers a plethora of tools, analytics, and features designed to boost your visibility and engagement. Use them, but don't rely on them entirely. Let these tools amplify your genuine voice rather than replacing it with a robotic echo.5. Listen ActivelyBefore jumping to post or comment, take a moment to listen. Understand what your network is talking about, what challenges they face, and what joys they celebrate. Active listening on LinkedIn can open doors to deeper, more meaningful interactions.6. Seek to Give, Not Just to GetApproach LinkedIn with a mindset of giving. Whether it's knowledge, opportunities, connections, or simply time ‚Äì when you give selflessly, you enrich the community and, in turn, enrich your own experience.7. Remember, People Connect with PeopleBrands, logos, and company names may catch attention, but it's the human stories and emotions behind them that foster real connections. So, present yourself as a multifaceted human being, not just a title or a job role.While the digital age tempts us to get lost in metrics, tools, and optimization hacks, let's remember the essence of LinkedIn: human connection. Embrace your humanity, let technology be your aide, and watch your LinkedIn journey transform.#leadgeneration #marketing #marketingstrategy
